DataElement.preferredName: Contrast Enhanced PET-CT Scan Total Lesion Uptake Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The value representing the lesional mean uptake of a radioactive marker multiplied by the lesion volume and expressed as a percentage of the injected dose obtained from a contrast enhanced PET-CT scan.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Contrast Enhanced PET-CT Scan Total Lesion Uptake
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A form of PET/CT imaging in which radiopharmaceuticals is either ingested or injected intravenously in an attempt to enhance the collected images for diagnostic purposes.:The lesional mean uptake of a radioactive marker compound multiplied by the lesion volume and expressed as a percentage of injected dose.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A form of PET/CT imaging in which radiopharmaceuticals is either ingested or injected intravenously in an attempt to enhance the collected images for diagnostic purposes.

Concepts.definition: A form of PET/CT imaging in which radiopharmaceuticals is either ingested or injected intravenously in an attempt to enhance the collected images for diagnostic purposes.

Property.preferredDefinition: The lesional mean uptake of a radioactive marker compound multiplied by the lesion volume and expressed as a percentage of injected dose.
